settings.grid-title: How to Style a Cashmere Sweater
settings.grid-content:
Depending on the season you’re styling for, play with different weights and styles - your knitwear doesn’t have to be reserved for the colder months. In spring, forego the jacket and opt for a light cashmere jumper over a blouse paired with a skirt.

When winter rolls around, our knits can become a safety blanket of sorts. Layer over a T-shirt and French tuck into a midi skirt or your best vintage jeans for a cosy, casual look. A cashmere jumper can add a touch of texture and volume that you didn’t know you were missing.

settings.title: How to Wash your Cashmere Sweater
settings.text:
Cashmere jumpers are an essential part of your everyday rotation. Along with your cashmere cardigans and cashmere accessories, they are all crafted from one of the world’s finest and most delicate threads, so they require careful looking after.

You can machine or hand wash your cashmere; do so every three to four wears unless visibly soiled. Use a delicate or knitwear cycle, on a cold wash at the lowest spin. We also recommend a gentle detergent such as a specialist cashmere shampoo or baby shampoo. To dry, lie your cashmere jumper on a flat surface in its natural shape, and cool iron on reverse if needed.

Store folded - never hung - with cedarwood stars to keep moths at bay, and be sure to spritz with a garment refresher in between washes.

For a more detailed guide to washing your knits, please read our full cashmere care guide.

MAKE SMALL, GRADUAL CHANGES

Small, gradual changes can make working towards a more sustainable lifestyle appear less overwhelming, particularly for those at the beginning of their journey. Start out small, do your research, and forgive yourself for occasional and minor setbacks - nobody becomes the perfect ethical fashion consumer overnight.
